data.name: InfiniteArrays.jl
data.description: A Julia package for representing infinite-dimensional arrays

evidence: "A Julia package for representing arrays with infinite dimension sizes, designed to work with other array types. Infinite arrays are by necessity lazy, and so this package is closely linked to LazyArrays.jl." (library-style package intended to be used by other Julia code)

Example usage shows `using InfiniteArrays, LinearAlgebra, FillArrays` and constructing objects like `x = Ones(∞)` and `Diagonal(1:∞)`, indicating it is a reusable array/linear-algebra component used in computations (directly affecting numerical results).
README includes a JuliaHub version badge: `https://juliahub.com/docs/General/InfiniteArrays/stable/version.svg`, indicating distribution via the Julia General package registry/JuliaHub.
